document.docAuthor: Nunes, Rafael V. & Vaz-de-Mello, Fernando Z.
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic revision of Dichotomius (Cephagonus) Luederwaldt 1929 and the taxonomic status of remaining Dichotomius Hope 1838 subgenera (Coleoptera: Scarabaeidae: Scarabaeinae: Dichotomiini)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic revision of Dichotomius (Cephagonus) Luederwaldt 1929 and the taxonomic status of remaining Dichotomius Hope 1838 subgenera (Coleoptera: Scarabaeidae: Scarabaeinae: Dichotomiini)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Pinotus ( Cephagonus ) spadiceus
ı
Luederwaldt 1929
ı p. 139 (redescription)

Pinotus acutircornus Luederwaldt 1930
ı p. 120 (description)ı new synonym

Pinotus ( Cephagonus ) acutircornus
ı Luederwaldtı 1936ı p. 214

Pinotus acuticornus
ı
Blackwelder 1944
ı p. 207

Pinotus spadiceus
ı
Blackwelder 1944
ı p. 208

Dichotomius ( selenocopris ) acuticornus
ı
Vaz-de-Mello 2000
ı p. 193

Dichotomius ( selenocopris ) spadiceus
ı
Vaz-de-Mello 2000
ı p. 193.

Diagnosis. this species is differentiated in the group by the following combined characters: males pronotum disc having 2 – 4 rounded lobes at anterior portion (as
D. ascanius
or
D. bicuspis
); males pronotum widely emarginated at anterior portion (like
D. socius , D. fissus , D. filgueirasi , D. quadraticeps
and
D. semicircularis
); paramera lacking distinct longitudinal excavation (dorsally and laterally); larger males reaching 15 mm ; distance of triangular projections on female sixth ventrite equal to 1/3 of the ventrite length ( Figure 9 (b)).

● HOLOTYPE of
Pinotus spadiceus

Redescription. colour: blackı shiny. Head : fronto-clypeal surface smooth. Inter-ocular space with fine punctures. Gena borders curved inward. Cephalic horn rounded at apex. Pronotum : anterior portion having a wide central emargination with a central pair of weak knobs on pronotum disc anterior margin; pronotum disc smoothı shiny. Posterior margin with a single row of ocellate punctures. Posterior angle excavated and with groups of 5 ocellate punctures. Metasternum : sides and anterior portion of anterior lobe with ocellate setigerous puncturesı setae shortı with similar size to those on legs. Elytra : striae impressed with distinguishable punctures separated by twice their diameter. Puncture on basis expanded forming a small fovea. Interstriae (except the 1st) flatı lacking microsculpture. 1st interstriae (suture) convex. Abdomen : punctures of each ventrite anterior margin interrupted medially. Sides of ventrites 1 – 5 with groups of 3 – 5 setigerous punctures. Aedeagus ( Figure 43 (c-e)): dorsallyı lacking basal and longitudinal excavations; sclerotised portion narrowing towards apex; apexes roundedı convergent. Laterallyı subtle declivity. Posterior margin with a wide emargination taking almost half of lateral paramera length. Ventrallyı basis with wide lateral excavations. Basis of subgenital plate acuteı advancing towards phalobasisı apically emarginated.

Morphological variation. males BL: 12 – 15 mmı PW:
6 – 9 mm
. Genitalia comparison allowed us to conclude that smaller males do not have a central emargination delimiting pronotal disc and cephalic horn consists of a low tubercle. Female BL: 11 – 15 mmı PW:
5 – 9 mm
. Distinguished from males as follows: Head: fronto-clypeal surface transversely wrinkledı interocular space with coarse punctures. Cephalic carina produced in a single low tubercle. Pronotum: simply convexı punctures weaker than on males but following same distribution pattern. Elytra: striae deeply impressedı punctures separated by twice their diameter. Abdomen: sixth ventrite bearing a pair of triangular projections reaching pygidium apical margin ( Figure 9 (b)). Distance between triangular projections equal to 1/3 the ventrite length. Disc with very fine punctures medially (viewed under 20x magnification).
